greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Perfect Abs. Real part of complex z such that Abs[(Total[Divisors[z]]-z)]=Abs[z].
comment: Having Perfect Abs is not as good as being Perfect. A complex number can also have Abundant Abs or Deficient Abs.
mathematica: Re[Sort[Select[Flatten[Table[a + b I, {a, 1, 500}, {b, 1, 500}]], Abs[Total[Divisors[ # ]] - # ] == Abs[ # ] &], Abs[ #1] < Abs[ #2] &]
results.author: _Ed Pegg Jr_, Jan 13 2005
ext: Ten more terms from _Hans Havermann_, Jan 15 2005
